intro: Cryptolepis sinensis subsp. africana, commonly known as African snake root, is a perennial shrub native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been traditionally used in herbal remedies for various ailments.
